intro: Gonolobus lanatus, commonly known as the hairy beggar's-tick, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the family Fabaceae, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gonolobus lanatus is typically found in moist, shaded areas and can be invasive in certain regions.
